alert.note: Alert for Bedford; Cambria; Somerset (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 23 at 2:21PM EST until February 25 at 12:00PM EST by NWS State College
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Heavy ice accumulation possible. Total ice accumulation of one quarter inch to one half inch possible. Total snow and sleet accumulation of up to one inch possible. * WHERE...Cambria, Somerset and Bedford Counties. * WHEN...Significant ice accumulation is most likely Thursday night through the predawn hours Friday morning. * IMPACTS...Power outages and tree damage are possible due to the ice. Significant travel disruptions are most likely to impact the Friday morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Precipitation will likely start as a wintry mix Thursday afternoon before transitioning to a prolonged period of freezing rain. Temperatures will climb above freezing Friday morning, ending the threat of freezing rain. Wind gusts between 25 and 35 mph are likely by late Friday morning.
info.instruction: There is the potential for significant winter weather that may impact travel. Review winter weather safety and preparedness information at weather.gov/winter. The latest forecast information can be found on the NWS State College Facebook page and Twitter @NWSStateCollege, or on the web at weather.gov/ctp.
